content.description: A sequence of liebacks following four independent bolts. Then traverse left in the upper sections, ending either at the anchors of Long Story Short or Den of Iniquity. There is one bolt added in between Den and Long Story to connect the routes. Same rating for both finishes.
content.location: Begins to the right of the large tree and to the right of Long Story Short.  The last route on the right side of the Studio

climbs.name: Tired of the Slaughter (AKA:  Stop Killing Wolves)

content.description: Link-up of Rogue Pack to Tired of All The Possibilities of It All. Start on Rogue Pack climbing to the ledge-y handhold after the 3rd bolt and then traverse right clipping the link-up bolt before joining with Tired of All The Possibilities of It All. This skips the cruxes of Rogue and Tired resulting in a slightly easier variation than either route by itself. Using a long draw for the first bolt after the traverse helps with rope drag but makes for an awkwardly low clip.

climbs.name: Tired of All The Possibilities of It All

content.description: Make use of marginal handholds and some good footwork to survive the physical climbing and clipping down low. Tricky lower angle climbing up higher requires some attention to stay out of trouble until the chains.
content.location: Easily recognizable by the permadraws on the second and third bolts. Ironically, given the name, this route follows the bolt line straight up and is not one of the multiple variations that connect to it.

content.description: Sustained climbing up a vertical face that you eventually expect to let up, but it never quite does. The finish trends left near the top, but you can head right to the anchor of Blowback for an alternate finish (at a similar grade).
content.location: Left of the ramp leading up Blowback, pulls through a miniature roof ~10ft off the ground.

content.description: Gently overhanging with tiring but non-cruxy climbing to a less steep and trickier finish. You'll end up very close to Never Snows in Hueco at the end, sharing a foothold or two, but different handholds. Strong candidate for the best route on The Studio.
content.location: Second route from the left. Near the big tree. Finishes just right of Never Snows in Hueco on anchors 5' higher.

content.description: Overhanging climbing with some crumbly rock still remaining. The bottom 5 ft of the route is often wet. The second-to-last bolt (5th from the ground?) is midway through the crux and is strenuous to clip, but the fall is clean even if you fall clipping.The difficulty eases around the last (6th?) bolt, but can feel quite pumpy after pulling the crux.
content.location: Farthest left route on the wall. By the big tree that marks the left end of the wall.

climbs.name: Modest House in a Modest Neighborhood

content.description: A bouldery start through a steep bulge leads to some fun, slightly pumpy edging.
content.location: This starts in the middle of the Studio Wall, around where the trail levels out, and at the low steep bulge ~8ft off the ground.

content.description: Short but fun and has a balancy start followed by pumpy liebacks and juggier finish. Bolting should keep you out of the tree. Anchor biner gates are quite stiff so you may be better off placing your own draws for leads.
content.location: Toward the right side of the studio, near the big tree.

content.description: Straight up through highly featured rock into a wide crack/dihedral feature fun and 3D movement.
content.protection: Bolts. Steel carabiners on anchor. Lower off.
content.location: Look for the wide crack about 15-20 feet up and follow the bolts that lead into it.

content.description: Thin face climbing with difficult feet leads to slightly steeper, but juggier finish.
content.location: Just right of the ramp leading up Blowback.

content.description: Link-up of Tired of All The Possibilities of It All to Rogue Pack. Start on Tired... clipping three bolts then traversing left clipping the link-up bolt before joining with Rogue Pack at the ledge-y handhold. This combines the cruxes of Tired... and Rogue... resulting in a harder variation than either route by itself. Using a long draw for the first bolt after the traverse helps with rope drag.
content.location: Same start as Tired of All of The Possibilities of It All.

content.description: Heads left up a steep corner system.
content.protection: Bolts. Steel carabiners on anchor. Lower off.

content.description: Shorter wall with a nice variety of routes that all pack a punch. If approaching from Quarantine Wall, follow the base of the cliff to the right. As the trail begins to head up a steep slope, cut to the right on a newer trail (easier) and follow it around the rise and straight to the sector. The Studio is just left of Old Growth Wall.
